Geothermal well.Description: Geothermal wells are used to extract hot water or steam from the earth's crust, which is then used to generate electricity in geothermal power plants.
Geothermal wells can be used in conjunction with geothermal heat pumps to provide heating and cooling for buildings by tapping into the stable temperature of the earth.
Geothermal wells are drilled into geothermal reservoirs to access the underground heat and fluid resources for various applications, including power generation and direct use.
Geothermal wells are a key component in harnessing geothermal energy, which is a renewable and sustainable source of power that can be used for electricity generation and heating purposes.
